intro: Williamsia panayensis, commonly known as the Panay willow, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are simple and ovate, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Williamsia panayensis is considered an endangered species.
